captions.text: based upon the novel by OLGA TASHLYKOVA
written by MARINA MEDNIKOVA, OLGA SOLOVYOVA
Vikie, I’m not in such a big hurry.

Kirie, I still cannot understand why
you don’t want my Dad to call Kuzmin.

Because I’ve been graduated with
honors and had lots of practical training.
I have my head and my hands.

And I’m able to get any job on my own.
Even at Kuzmin’s Department.

It’s going to be simpler
and faster that way.
I want to get the job on my own.

This is why I need  no patronage,
either your father’s or someone else’s.
Produced by: YURI MINZIANOV, VLAD RIASHYN

No. I need to get back my
dress and do my hair. No.

You’re the most beautiful without that.
Okay, see you tonight then.
Thank you. All’s going to be okay.
You were supposed to be called… it’s…

Will you check up please?
It’s very important.
Ah! The Commission is raging today.

Kuzmin turns down every
single project today.

If they turn down you,
then I have no idea what they want.
Come on Iggie, we’ll make it.

I’d never miss such a noble
gathering. No way.

Your father-in-law must have
invited all his bigwig friends.
Do you know if Kuzmin’s coming?

I just understood that it’s high time to
move up, to a new, relevant level.
What are you going to present?

I’d like to present a project of an entertainment
park under working title “Crazy Village”.

As public opinion polls show,
entertainment and show become more

and more important for leisure
of a city inhabitant.

And, as strange as it may seem, park amusements
are among the main objects of attraction.

Let’s skip the introduction.
Come to the core.

Architecture and structure
of the park is decided here

as a deconcentrated layout
of the park amusements.
No, Vika. Not now. Call me later.

Kirie’s having a job interview at Kuzmin’s
Department, presenting his project.

You know he’s not going
to be employed without your call.

Okay. I will after I land.
In a half an hour.
Dad, it needs to be done now. Please.

And, the last area - family amusements - with
a Ferris wheel, bumper cars, bumper boats,

The Crossroad of Fortune,
and a laser shooting gallery.

Yes, it is. If there is any questions,
I’m ready to answer.

The project, of course, is interesting,
but it’s far from nowadays realities…

Hallo? Viktor Petrovich, my good friend!
What do I owe you call to?
Ah! It’s such a really great event!

Accept my warmest congratulations.
Yes. Yes…

I understand you perfectly well.
Of course yes.
It’s such an honor for me…
Surely, Viktor Petrocivh, of course yes.

I wish you compliments once again.
Good bye.

I think we need a fresh
perspective on things.
A fresh blood, so to say.

Therefore
I think you project is good for us.

Come to my office tomorrow
and we will discuss the details.

Mikhalych… My congratulations
to you and Vika.
As future member of the Brunevsky family.
That’s great! What’s wrong about it?

Nothing great, Oleg! Is it really so great
when someone decides for you?

Wait, wait… You’ve got an Aladdin lamp,
so use it!
Then what did I study for?

You still have it and Vika’s care with
her dad’s connections in addition.

All that’s needed for
a breathtaking career!
Many guys marry frights for that purpose.

And your Vika is smart and beautiful,
loving you in addition.

And she’ll be deciding for me
the rest of my life.

Oh, come on! Will you really
waste such a chance? It…

it can happen only once in one’s lifetime.
It’s a dream!
Come on! By the way, I’ve got an idea.

What if I tell the Commission than we’ve
developed the floating house together?
I’ll probably be hired too, eh?

Okay, okay. I got it. Lady, can you imagine?
What project to you present?

Kirie, where have you been?
All assembled! We’re waiting for you!

No, they don’t.
Said it’s far from nowadays realities.
They first said me this too.
Okay, come and show them what we can do.

Gentlemen, I appreciate you’ve come to support
me and my beloved daughter this important day.
See? This all is because of you.

Kirill! … To the fridge… and hurry.
Hurry. Hi!

Kirill, what’s up? Why are you
late for half an hour?

Why should I wait for you alone,
like an idiot?
Why did you call your father?

Freeze! Will you wait for us? Kirill
and I are going to, aren’t we?
Vika, do you take me for an idiot?

Okay. Yes, I called him. What’s wrong
with this? I’m doing this for you.

We had a deal, didn’t we?!
You knew I wanted…

You wanted to work… you wanted
to work for Kuzmin. And eventually you do.

I’m not talking about the result now.
I’m talking about the means.

I don’t want to use the protections
of your father.

Then you perhaps don’t like
my family, do you?

Vika, I do like your family. But I want to have my
own family together with you, understand?
I want to count on my own only.

Otherwise I’ll be Brunevsky’s son-in-law,
not Kirill Makarov for the rest of my life!
Don’t shout at me, will you?!

Or you will fail to become Brunevsky’s
son-in-law indeed.

Come. Why did you put on this ugly suit?
I’ve bought you a new one.
I feel more comfortable in it.
I’m so sorry! Are you okay?

Eh… It needs to be sprinkled
over with some salt…

What salt! You… Do you understand how much does
this shirt cost?! More than your year’s salary, goose!

I didn’t mean to, I really didn’t.
Forgive me.

Mind your step when walking!
You’re at work!
Vika, it’s okay. Hear me? It’s okay.
She spoiled my celebration! It’s okay!

Forgive me, please!
I’ve I made my apologies, didn’t I?!
What?! Apologies?! Call the manager now!

No. She’s spoiled our celebration,
don’t you understand it?!

Don’t worry, please,
I’ll clean it up. I’ll…

- Vika, enough. Calm down please.
- Get out!

- I said no. Vika, calm down!
- - Get out!
Kirill, I think you should change…
No, miss, no! Don’t do. I will leave!

I’ve spoiled your shirt, forgive me.
I’ll wash it.
I’ll give you my phone number.

You give me a call, bring it
to me and I’ll fix it.

Dear miss, please. No need.
I’ll fix it on my own.
Don’t be angry with Vika, please, okay?

It’s just that she always received
things very easily.

… I’m an ordinary man, just like you.
Would wish to remain one.

I’m told I’ve received
an Aladdin’s lamp and don’t use it.
Aladdin’s lamp is nothing but a tale.

Only a man is responsible for
his own live and happiness.
Yes… Third year, the teaching college.
I was working when studying too.

I see… It’s easier to work there.
No encounters with such difficult clients.

Really? Know how difficult
foremasters might be?
Ah! Here you are. We go, eh?
A wise man had a daughter.

And two men asked her in marriage –
a rich and a poor.
You… Where have you been? Come. Come now.
Wait, Vikie. We need to talk.

And the wise man told to the rich:
“I won’t… give my daughter to you.
And gave her to the poor.
Where to? It’s only about to begin!

No. You don’t understand.
I’m leaving…. you. For ever.

And when he was asked why
he did that way, he answered:…

“The rich one is stupid and
is sure to become poor.

The poor one is smart – he’s sure
to reach happiness and well-being.

Vikie, you… you’re very beautiful!
You’re very smart! You’re outstanding! You…

you’re a dream girl, but we cannot
be together. We’re way different!

Wait, wait… It’s because I called
my dad today, right?

… brain, not money, is to be taken
into account when choosing the fiancé.

Thank you for everything. But this
way would be better. Forgive me!
Kira! What’s it with you? What’s up?

How parted? Why? It’s all
right with you, isn’t it?

Not so good.
And would become even worse.

Well, Makarov… I knew you would
do in your own way!...

Hi. River Street.
We can’t pay more than 100.

Do you want to clean your shirt
in the middle of the night?

Lena, come on, Get in;
you’ll finish in the car.
Wait. I’ll be with my friend.
Me too. Nice coincidence, isn’t it?
Get out. I say get out.
Excuse us, please. We’re not going.

Going, not going… You gals
never know what you want.
The guy I was talking in the back yard.
He and his friend invited us on a date.
Shall we go to the cinema?

Guys, come on.
Why standing there? I’m Oleg.
We go to the cinema too?

Lara, has anybody told
to you that you’d film well?

Ilya, who’s supposed to
take your toys after you played?
I said many times we should buy a new one.

Why new one? It’s only a crack in the case.
I’ll tape it and it’s going to be okay.

Lena, you’ve chopped
the stuffing too roughly.

I’ve done as needed.
Re-chop if you dislike.
Olie, remember to take the present.
What a fresh air is here!

Stop it! Are you saying my
toasts are bad? Eh? Okay…
No, I’m saying you dishes are the best.
This is for Makarov, this is for Lena.
Please, put the cap on if you’re told to.

Oh! That’s the day he’s going
to obey! Sure!
You strong guy! Don’t break my hand!
Lena, I’ve got a reason to celebrate too.

No. Afraid to.
What if it’s not so good?

Come on! You’re… Your stories are so nice,
Lara. They must publish them.

And I want them to. I even invented
a pseudonym – Lara Belts.
To my mind it’s much more poetic…

Really think so? Belts is more poetic?
I’m not sure…
The city competition finishes in 2 weeks.
We could be in time if we did a push.

They don’t need us. With no connections…
I bet: some guy from Kuzmin will win.

Listen, Makarov… What a stupid
attitude you have?

And you know…
I don’t like you like that at all.
Kira, is something serious happened? Eh?

Nothing happens to me,
Oleg. You know this. For long.
And that’s the point. I work.

I’ve got some drafts, I’ve got finished
projects. But nobody needs them.

Change the surroundings.
Go somewhere and have some rest.
You’ll recover and go in action again.

Ilya’s growing up and needs
things to be bought again and again.

His foot is an adult size.
I’m torn apart. I'm no millionaire.
This is it. I’m talking right about this.

Agree to my project and
you’ll become a millionaire at once.
Guys, are you coming? We’re prepared.

(song) “Going down the river I
noticed one day it was ice-glazed.

I was too far and was seeking for the tail
wind and breaking the ice with the paddle.

And I reached the end of all
possible distances, absolutely light,

With no crown or castle - with hot coffee
in hand and the map of the globe in my sack.”
Going down the river I noticed one day…”

How about Lara’s novel?
When do they publish it?
She surely will be if she doesn’t send it.
You don’t send your designs too.
You cannot win if you don’t bid.
He who earns money is talented.

You’ve got so many amazing ideas.
It’s just no one knows of them.
Lena, enough. No one needs them.
Stop saying like this! They do.
You should just be a bit more active.

But bear in mind: I’ll get
jealous if it’s from a woman.

Invitation for the graduates
from the Architecture College.

Oh! It’s 10 years that
I graduated the college this year.
What if you meet there someone to help you?

You told you were almost hired
for Kuzmin’s Department, weren’t you?
Almost. But the conditions didn’t fit.
You go. I have some work to do.

You know, Kirie’s been invited for a class
reunion and he doesn’t want to come.

Don’t know. Perhaps he’s afraid
of everyone boasting at it.
And he has nothing suitable to put on.

He might meet that
millionaire’s daughter there.
Hope she’s become old and fat.

She’s going to look like a queen for the
rest of her life with the money she has.

As opposite to my case. I’m growing
fat year after year.

I want to make a present to Kira.
It’s his birthday.
I mean letting him feel an achiever.

To book some deluxe suite in a five star
hotel, with everyone buzzing about him…
Why are you so nervous, eh?

I’m going to be out of work
for some two years.

And he’s going to shoulder
all the family burdens.
What would I say to him?
I feel in my heart it’s going to be a girl.
O my gosh! What a nasty sound!
Just a world’s champion in nastiness.

You won’t believe, but in need to go
to the school. I work there. Sleep.

Just stop reproaching me
with your work, will you?
I don’t. You just asked, and I answered.

You think I don’t feel your hints that you
might stay at home caring about the son,
if you had a different husband?

I don’t need a different one.
I’d be quite satisfied with this one if…

If I had an income, right? Come on!
Spill what’s on your mind. Go ahead!
Money is never a bad thing!

By the way, do you remember we must repay
the loans the day after tomorrow?
Do I look like a sclerotic man?!

Why so much annoying?
I just reminded you.

And remember to have Ilie’s trainers
mended. Let they glue them up.

You think I cannot afford
new trainers for my son, right?

No, I’m not a millionaire.
No, I cannot solve all our problems at once.
I’m not picking a bone with you.

And don’t sigh like that. Find the money
for a new coat for you from what we have.
How does the coat come in all this?

To be frank, there’s a big fat zero can be found
in what we have. Not enough for a coat.

And no one cares a damn
about what I wear. Right?

I haven’t a stitch to wear
for the class reunion.
Outstanding! I’ve borrowed a flat from you,

a summer house from your parents,
now a suit from Oleg!

I have absolutely nothing.
I’m a beggar!
You’ve got your son and your wife.
Excuse me, do you have a light?

I didn’t recognize you!
You’ll be in the money.

I first didn’t recognize you too.
You’ve so much changed! Got imposing.

There, in the corner. Come on.
A personal identification process.
From your appearance you’re all right, eh?!

(Song) “You don’t remember how it
was and don’t know how it’s going to be…”

(Song) “Life now is just frozen. You used to be
daring, you used to be full of ideas…”

(Song) “Life starts its flow again, and one word
is enough to change it. Only a reason needed…”
I searched for you and couldn’t find.
We’ve got a house in a suburb.

No. It’s not what you thought of.
Not a mansion.
A summer house of my wife’s parents.
And how do you find it there? Like?

In the summer house
of your wife’s parents?

I see you’re all right: a job,
a house, a family… Are you happy?
I am, I believe. I’ve got a son.

I was. And didn’t like.
Prefer being single.

(Song) “Life starts its flow again,
and one word is enough to change it…”
Isn’t it beautiful? I’ve bought it today.

How are you going to drive?
You’ve drunk alcohol.
Kirie, don’t be a dopy. I’ve got a driver.
A new one too, by the way. Nicolas.
What is it with you? Vika, are you okay?
Shall I bring some water for you?

Ouch… it’s going to ease off now.
 I felt giddy.
Look, maybe you should see the doctor?

Don’t look at me with the eyes like these.
Yes, I am pregnant.

And have no time to do an abortion because
of all these gatherings and parties.

But I’ve booked an appointment.
For tomorrow.
What? You don’t want to have kids?
All the more with a first guy around.

Kirie, you did well. You did it right.
Just as you wanted.

And I’ve got nothing
but tinsel in my life. Farewell.

She looks great! Did you see her gems?
It the last Cartier collection. I saw it.

Just a few are lucky
to have parents like she has.

I’ look even better with
such money she has. Believe me?

How could you let
such an Aladdin’s lamp go?
My wife’s waiting for me at home.
The River Street is too far.
I’ve never seed a lady taxi driver.
It’s an early hour, isn’t it?
A wife, kids, family troubles, duties…
Only a man is his own life’s master.

Absolutely. I changed things
one day long ago. I did.
And There’s no going back now.
Do you want to have it back?
That’s not true. All things are possible.

In this case everyone’d
use this opportunity.

So many times I read in the papers
and watched on the TV…

when a person was asked: “If you had
a chance to start your live anew?”

And everyone answers:
“I wouldn’t change anything.” Lies!
Everyone would wish to change some things.
Are you sure you really need this?
Your fates are in your power.
Kirill? Kirill? Do you hear me?
Vika, what are you doing here?

Sir, can you rise?
Let me help you to sit up.
What butler? How did I get here?

You have been living
here for ten years already.

Only some bruises, which is absolutely
normal for a fall like that.

What’s it with his head? He doesn’t
recognize people, asking strange questions.
Kirill Mikhaylovich, do you recognize me?

Great Pavlov was absolutely right.
He doesn’t recognize even me!

But I wouldn’t draw any conclusion
without a proper examination.

O my God! What shall I do?
It’s his birthday!...

Ah banquet… No, of course not!
You know what?
Let’s observe him till the lunchtime.

If some complications arise,
call me at once.
Perhaps, he’d better have a drink, eh?

Arkadiy, will you attend…
Kirill Mikhaylovich
while I’m seeing off the doctor?

Well, you know… as academician Pavlov…
would say… it’s still disputed that…

Tell me, Arkadiy, you’re an actor,
aren’t you?

Tell me, was this Lena who organized
all this? A birthday surprise. Eh?

I wouldn’t recommend
you to mention female names
even when Viktoria Viktorovna is absent.
She even instigated Vika? She’s great!
Okay, what’s next in the script?
Usually, you go to your work.
You’re the CEO of the company.

Is he my driver?
My personal driver?

To the office. Emil…
Kirill Mikhaylovich is indisposed.

That’s why call at once if anything
goes wrong. Do you understand me?
You go, Kirill Mikhaylovich, we’ll wait.
No, thanks. I’ve already had it today.

There was a call from the City Hall.
They confirmed the invitation.

And you’ve got an appointment
with vendors in 2 hours.

Viktor Petrovich, I propose to send
the present with a courier.
Yes, a good idea. Do as you think best.

Vika told you felt unwell
and would be absent from work.

I wanted to discuss
Timofeyev’s proposition with you. Come.

Excuse me, sir. This is unnecessary,
I mean it. Excuse me for God’s sake.

Excuse me! Excuse me, for God’s sake!
Enough. That’s enough!

It’s not my life.
It’s different all around.

Of course it is.
YOU chose this one day.

One day you made a decision, a choice.
And now your life was what it was.

Then you regretted of you choice and had a
chance to change it. And I helped you a bit.

Now you live in a luxurious mansion and have
a flourishing business and a charming wife.
Now you are in no want of anything.

Is this for ever? Will it
disappear when I wake up?
It’s not a dream; it’s your new life.
But if you say you dislike it…
No… I won’t… I’ll never go back.
Well… But if you change you mind…

And thank you.
Thank you for everything!

It’s not the destiny who chooses
the man, but he chooses it.

I’m Boris, your personal assistant. I’ve
been working with you for 4 years already.

Accept my warmest congratulations
in connections to your birthday!
All are assembled in the conference hall.

Dear Kirill Mikhaylovich. We congratulate
you with your anniversary
and would wish to present you this.
Of course. It’s a real rarity.

You probably know I was clumsy
to fall down this morning.

I thank you all for your
gift and attention.

Do you know if Oleg Sorokin
works for our company?

He’s an architect. We studied
at the same college class.
I couldn’t have missed to hire him.

Well, I don’t have this information,
but I can find out if you need it.

Yes, please. Do it as a priority.
Oleg N. Sorokin.

Kirill Mikhaylovich. There’s no such
name among our employees.

Boria, could you find
out his address for me?

Kirill Mikhaylovich, I’ve found out
Sorokin’s home address and phone number.
I can get you through now, if you wish.

Kira Makarov. Don’t you
recognize your best friend?

Boria, it was something
wrong with the line.

Yes. It disconnected.
I can redial if you wish.
Well… No, thanks. And what’s his address?

And by the way, Viktoria Viktotovna called. She
asked whether you would come home to lunch.

Boria, lend me a rouble, will you?
Ah! You’re not Boria.

Hi. I’d like to know
where Oleg Sorokin lives.

Fumbler, you’ve got a visitor!
A midget just like you!
Know how many skirts I had?!
An eunuch has plenty of skirts too!
I’m Kirill. Don’t you recognize me?
I did when you called me.
Then why did you put the phone?

I remember only college events, before we
graduated, and what was after I fell down.
And nothing about 10 years in between.

And you know, I drink
and drink again and fall and fall again…

And it’s painful to remember everything,
buddy, very painful.
Olie, Olie… What’s it with you?
You were always full of brilliant ideas.
I still remember your floating house.

Why didn’t you come
to see me when you had troubles?
How do I know? Ask Sorokin!
Stop yelling! I didn’t touch it!

But you couldn’t care less
about my brilliant ideas.

Your profits were good enough without
them. Why changing something?
I don’t understand. Did I refuse you?
You know, I wish I could tank up

… new ideas mean
not only potential profit

And only he who has no possessions
can afford risking.

Because in this case we win if
we win and we don’t lose if we fail.
Do you play dumb on purpose?! Do you?!

I’m telling you I’ve got amnesia –
I don’t remember anything! Understand this?!

Look, you Makaronov!
Makaronov, right? Get out of here.
See a dame’s waiting for me, eh?

You’re a man of business, busy with all kinds of
contracts and whatever… Go mind your business.

Hear me, alky?
Shall I fry potatoes for you?

Look, I’m the CEO of my own company now.
Just call me and I’ll hire you.

You shall have a good salary.
Everyone in my company has… Oleg…

Valia, he’s looking for some Lara.
He’s nuts!
Kirill Mikhaylovich, can I help you?
It’s okay. I feel like eating something.

The lunch is ready.
Victoria Vikrtorovna is back too.

She was absent in connection
with the today’s celebration.
It’s my birthday today, isn’t it?

Arkadiy. It’s really something
wrong with my head today.

Drop me hints where should
I go and what to do, will you?
Good evening. It’s pleasure to see you.

Good evening, Kirill Mikhaylovich. We’re happy
to offer our congratulations on your birthday.

We’re always glad to work under your guidance.
Many happy returns of this day.
That is a London banker with his new lover.

Hello. Dear Kirin Mikhaylovich, I’m very happy
to extend felicitation on your birthday.

and wish you all the best. For since the
beginning of our colla... collabor…

… collaboration you proved to be
a reliable partner. Just a second…
I hope we will continue to be friends.

Charles loves to drink and,…
you know what I mean.

Good evening. Very much pleased to see you.
Good evening.

If you will excuse me, I need
to leave you for a moment.
Off with them. They’ll wait. Turkeys.

- I’m constantly waiting Ilie
might come in any moment.
What’s up? I just wanted to know…
We have and never had any children.

Well, I really don’t know.
I don’t remember.
You’ve bashed your head really hard today.

At first you said we should live for our
own pleasure and to see the world.
Then - when I got unexpectedly pregnant –

you told that kids would distract
you from your career, your life.
Then you made me do an abortion
and I did it because I loved you.
This cant be true, because I love children.
And it cannot be checked in practice.

And my father, by the way, doesn’t know
this, that’s why he asks of kids so often.
Don’t say you feel sorry for me.
You’d better feel sorry for you.

You’ve lived all you life with
a woman you’ve never loved.

Vikie, wait. Just wait. You…
Is it really so bad with us?
We live in a large and beautiful house.

You own a flourishing business.
You… you’re a millionaire!
You’ve achieved whatever you strived for.
No. I wished a family, wanted to have kids.
Go to hell with your wishes!!!
I need you help. I need to find a woman.
You mentioned her name after you fell down.
Yes, I need to find Lena.
I don’t know the present one.

She’s got a friend – Larissa Sorokina.
Maiden name Belts.
Everyone knows her. She’s a famous writer.

She has… She writes harlequin books,
but they are truly good.
Arkadiy, I need to have her address.
Beg my pardon, what’s your name?

Taisiya Sergeyevna,
I must apologize for such a late visit.

That’s okay. Larissa Nikolayevna
almost always awake at nights.

She was glad to that you called her.
Come in, please.
Yes… We met once at a student party.
Oh!... That was in another life.
Do you know of another life?
Pehaps, even better than anyone else.

I would never figure that someone of my
acquaintances would become a company CEO.

You were always writing.
You wanted to become a writer.
I’m glad your dreams have come true.

They have. I had no other choice
but to become a writer.

It’s true I was surprised
at your secretary’s call.

Do you want to invest in filming
of a novel by me?
I thought all world knows I’m disabled.

But your hands move and brain work even if
you spend long days in the wheelchair.

Sometimes I think if I had
a husband and kids…

I probably would have never
found time for writing.
I’m very sorry it happened like this.

We had part-time waiter
jobs at a restaurant.
And we got a cab after it.

We fell asleep in the back seat,
and the driver in the front one.

Arkadiy, what is going on?! Why should
I search for you everywhere? Where’s Kirill?
I have no least idea, ma’am.
How?.. It’s your job, isn’t it?!

Yes, ma’am…
But Kirill Mikhaylovich didn’t report me.

Kirill! Kirill, what’s going on?
Where have you been?

Why did you leave
me alone with your guests?
It was me who killed Lena…

What are you talking about?
Are you drunk?
I was the cause of everyone’s misfortunes –
It was I who killed Lena…
Emil, what on earth is going on?

You should come to your senses,
come with me

to our house where your
friends are awaiting for you.

Don’t come any closer!
They are not my friends!

Stay where you are! They are not
my guests! It’s not my house!
I’m very much guilty toward you.

Having no children doesn’t mean
we are not happy.

I don’t wish to! I don’t wish living like that…
I wish it to be just like it was before!
You’re very tired. Very much tired.

It’s your damned work.
Want we escape?! Want you?
No. I don’t. I don’t want to escape…

Let’s escape right now…
Come to a club to dance?

Okay, then we go to
that bloody class reunion.
You wanted to be there so much!…

They’d be happy to see you.
It’s at your favorite restaurant.
O my God! O my God! O my God!
“Your fates are in your power”? We’ll see.

With such good progress,
we’ll discharge him very soon.

You can say happy new birthday
to your husband.

My God, Kirie! You gave
us quite a turn with this accident…
Lena… I… I love you so much, hear me?
Me too! Thank God you’re alive.
No. YOU forgive me, will you?
I love you so much too.
Hallo! Yes, Kirie’s come to his senses…

You’re a man, you’re responsible for her…
got it?
And what do you want, Kirill Makarov?
Vika, have you seen the doctor yet?
You told it at the party... Forget it…
Vika, please, don’t do that. Leave it.

No matter who his father is. Counts only that
you’ll become a mother. Do you understand me?

Just leave it, and you’re going
to be happy… Promise me!
Look who’s here to see you.
By George, I’ve missed you so much!

It’s just as if I haven’t
seen you for years!

You’ve tricked me like a child…
And I swallowed.

It’s children’s champagne,
I’d say Demi-Sec…

So, I wish to drink
to your fastest recovery…

No! No! I propose to drink
to our future writer.
Oh, come on. Not a writer at all…
Yes, you are. A true writer. Listen to me.

Lara, I believe you should
muster up your nerve

and sent your typescript
to every publisher.

You will surely make it. They ought
to publish it. What say you?
Thank you, Kirie. Perhaps I should…

By the way, Olie, you said about some
new competition, didn’t you?

I was thinking, perhaps we should give
battle to Kuzmin’s guys, shall we?
You recover, and we’ll give them battle

We’re in the hospital!
Excuse us for God’s sake.

And, respectively, this axis that’s going
to be formed with the tower here…

should look that direction,
toward that tower, you see?
Ah, I see. It’s clear now.

title: Миллионер / The Millionaire. Фильм. StarMedia. Фильмы о Любви. Мелодрама. 2012

comments.text:
Давно еще смотрела этот фильм отрывками, теперь вот решила посмотреть

on nashel sebe rabotu i pomogal svoei semie - on opiat oskorbliaetsa vmesto 
togo chtobi poiti i naiti rabotu kak muzhchina. Etot isterik - luzer menia 
razdrazhaet. On ne zasluzhivaet ni odnoi iz teh dvuh krasavic.﻿
